channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Delta CEO Ed Bastian signals no exit yet—but hints at succession plan
item.description: Delta CEO Ed Bastian, 67, is nearing his ninth year at the airline's helm.

item.title: Trump’s Social Security nominee is a Fortune 500 CEO. Will he fix the agency’s customer-service problems, or run afoul of Musk’s war on costs?
item.description: Fiserv CEO Frank Bisignano has the credentials to upgrade Social Security, but faces broad distrust because of DOGE's cuts.

item.title: Microsoft turns 50 as the world’s second largest company—trying not to fall behind on AI
item.description: Microsoft has been at the heart of computing for half a century, becoming a tech stalwart almost taken for granted as lifestyles embraced the internet...

item.title: Microsoft’s memorable cultural legacies at 50, from Clippy to the Blue Screen of Death
item.description: Every one of its design decision is felt around the world for better or worse—often staying with people for years as a fond memory or a meme.

item.title: Volvo Car brings back Samuelsson as CEO to steer turnaround
item.description: Hakan Samuelsson's reappointment as CEO sees ex-Dyson boss Jim Rowan evicted from the role after just three years.

item.title: Investors looking for clarity on Trump’s tariffs on April 2 risk disappointment
RBC identifies the key level that the S&P 500 needs to hold
The market is starting to price in more aggressive tariffs, says Morgan Stanley
HSBC says three different scenarios are bullish for gold, which is at a record.
Everything you wanted to know about a recession but were afraid to ask
